Description: The Federal Communications Commission announced an $11.9 million fine against Purple Communications for improperly billing the Telecommunications Relay Service (TRS) Fund, which enables persons with speech or hearing disabilities to make and receive phone calls.

The FCC's Enforcement Bureau released a consent decree with Purple Communications, Inc. that required the company to pay approximately $22 million to the Telecommunications Relay Service (TRS) Fund, resolving Bureau investigations into whether Purple overbilled the TRS Fund by artificially inflating TRS usage.
